description.narrative: Enhanced National capacity to support the Implementation of Myanmar’s REDD+ Readiness Roadmap through enhancing the National capacity for the implementation of REDD+ under the UNFCCC and developing relevant (technical, legal, social) systems

participating-org.narrative: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Existence of representation and consultation systems. 1.2 Functioning UN-REDD PEB, TF, RO and TWGs 2.1 Level of stakeholder satisfaction with measures for REDD+ awareness raising and information flow. 2.2 Legal and policy amendments adopted. 3.1 Delivery of required elements of a national approach to safeguards. 3.2 Degree to which key areas of stakeholder concerns (socioeconomic, environmental) are addressed through data and information content of the SIS. 5.1 National REDD+ strategy approved. 5.2 Approved REDD+ Investment Programme.

comment.narrative: 1.1 Following implementation of Targeted Support (TS), informal systems (TWGs) have been established or strengthened; but the TF has not been established. 1.2 TF does not exist; RTO does not exist; 3 TWGs established during Roadmap development and re-established with TS. 2.1 Can be assumed to be zero, since there were essentially no institutional measures for REDD+ awareness raising and information flow before the initiation of the programme. 2.2 No modifications. 3.1 No definition of and national approach to safeguards consistent with the Cancun Agreements of COP 16 exists. 3.2 No reporting framework and SIS exists. 5.1 REDD+ readiness road map is available, but no National REDD+ Strategy. 5.2 No investment programme.

Target 1. Engagement with ethnic nationalities: Kokang, Karenni, Shan, Chin and Kachin on REDD+ Strategy Consultations. To have consultation with all NCA-S EAOs on REDD+ Strategy, the consultation meeting with NCA-S Working Committee on Land and Environment was conducted in March 2019. The meeting with KNU (NCA-S EAO) was also conducted for Strategy consultation. As per the comments received through online consultation, the four consultation workshops on the most controversial or unclear PAMs (Policies and Measures) have been held during the 1st Q of 2019. As the preparation of piloting the Myanmar REDD+ Strategy implementation, a meeting with Community Forestry National Working Group was conducted to have discussion on how the pilot project should go forward. For the process of developing the REDD+ Investment Plan, the UNDP’s climate change expert has been invited in July to have necessary advices on the process. To brief on the REDD+ Strategy’s specific policies and measures to the related Departments, the pre-meeting with key individual departments were conducted before the REDD+ Strategy National Validation Workshop. Before conducting the Validation Workshop, the meeting with the REDD+ Core Unit under the Forest Department was held to have discussion /comments on PaMs related to the Department. The National Validation Workshop on REDD+ Strategy was conducted in Sep 2019 with the participation of government agencies, CSOs/NGOs, Ethnic Groups, NCA-S EAOs, private sector, UN agencies and international organizations.
Target 2. Support to conduct 4 REDD+ Task Force meeting during the 2019 and conducted 2 Programme Executive Board Meetings in order to receive the guidance of the implementation of the programme throughout the year. Driver and Strategy Technical Working Group Meeting was conducted before the REDD+ Strategy validation workshop to have discussion on REDD+ Strategy.
Target 3. Provided 15 Trainings on REDD+ Policy and Measures for the Government Officers from different Departments of 15 State/Region and 5 Trainings were conducted for CSOs/NGOs from 15 State/regions. A meeting with Editors for sharing REDD+ related activities was organized. Revision of Knowledge Management and Communication Strategy, REDD+ Programme Website and social media were conducted. The REDD+ Related IEC materials with 12 different languages, brouchers for REDD+ reporting requirement to UNFCCC, monthly knowledge product on REDD+ related have been developed. Developed TV interview programme on Stakeholder engagement process on REDD+ Strategy Development and REDD+ implementation and broadcast through MRTV. In term of the activities for the development of the required Policy, Legal framework, contributed to the development of Myanmar Forest Rules by providing support to the sub-national level and community level consultations and expert round table meeting. Comparison of government and ethnic policies/regulations was conducted. Options for REDD+ Finance Management were identified and the report is available.
Target 4. Piloting FPIC and proposed design for GRM was conduct in Mawlamyine District.
Target 5. Table of SIS information sources/system and archive of relevant information and draft design document for Myanmar’s REDD+ Safeguards Information System is available. Development of operationalization plan for SIS is on-going and SOI (Summary of Information) is on hand. The practical capacity building activities are ongoing through consultations, workshops, meetings on Strategy, SIS and SOI development.
Target 6. Stakeholder Survey was conducted in December 2019 in order to access the indicators set at the logical framework of the programme and prepared evaluation report and submitted to its Programme Executive Meeting in December 2020.

1.1 Representation and consultation systems are operational and remain so thereafter 1.2 The level of satisfaction for all entities is at least 67% and remains at this level or higher 2.1 At least 70% of stakeholders consider that institutional measures for REDD+ awareness raising are satisfactory or good 2.2 At least 75% of the proposed modifications have been enacted; the process for the remaining modifications is underway 3.2 Fully functional safeguards information system is in place including a country-level grievance mechanism. 4.2 (4.2 as per AWP and Atlas but 5.2 in the log frame) Initial pilot activities under implementation in priority states/regions
